title: 2014 Billboard Music Awards
text:
The 2014 <a href="Billboard%20Music%20Awards">"Billboard" Music Awards</a> ceremony was held on May 18, 2014, at the <a href="MGM%20Grand%20Garden%20Arena">MGM Grand Garden Arena</a> in <a href="Las%20Vegas">Las Vegas</a>, <a href="Nevada">Nevada</a>. It aired live on <a href="American%20Broadcasting%20Company">ABC</a> at 8:00/7:00 PM Central. The show was hosted by <a href="Ludacris">Ludacris</a>.
<a href="Justin%20Timberlake">Justin Timberlake</a> won 7 out of his 11 nominations, including Top Artist, Top Male Artist and top Billboard 200 Artist for "<a href="The%2020/20%20Experience">The 20/20 Experience</a>". Other winners included <a href="Imagine%20Dragons">Imagine Dragons</a> who won five of their 12 nominations and <a href="Robin%20Thicke">Robin Thicke</a>, <a href="Pharrell%20Williams">Pharrell Williams</a> and <a href="T.I.">T.I.</a> scoring four trophies each. <a href="Lorde">Lorde</a> had 12 nominations. <a href="Katy%20Perry">Katy Perry</a> had 10 nominations, including top artist, top female and Hot 100 artist. <a href="Miley%20Cyrus">Miley Cyrus</a> received nine nominations, including top artist, top female, Hot 100 artist and top streaming artist. <a href="Macklemore%20%26amp%3B%20Ryan%20Lewis">Macklemore & Ryan Lewis</a> had eight nominations, including top duo/group. At the ceremony, <a href="Jennifer%20Lopez">Jennifer Lopez</a> received the <a href="Billboard%20Icon%20Award">Icon Award</a>. 
The 2014 "Billboard" Music Awards had performances by Shakira, One Republic, John Legend, Lorde, Jason Derulo, Carrie Underwood, Miley Cyrus, among others. It was produced by <a href="Dick%20Clark%20Productions">Dick Clark Productions</a>. <a href="Allen%20Shapiro">Allen Shapiro</a> and Mike Mahan were executive producers, with Barry Adelman, Mark Bracco, and <a href="Larry%20Klein">Larry Klein</a> as producers.
Winners and nominees.
Winners are listed first.
